Comments_List: photonic bands, the local density of states and that in radiations, equivalence principles, reciprocity, temporal coupled mode theory, quasinormal modes, as well as computational methods in photonics.

The lectures are well-organized and cover important topics in photonics. Problem sets are helpful. Some important research articles are introduced and so students can immediately see the significance or the usefulness of things just learned.
On certain topics, especially some in the computational methods, only conclusions are given. I was wondering if there are quick explanations.
Yes. It's an advanced course in electrodynamics and in modern photonics. The lectures and problem sets greatly help develop analytical and computational techniques.
